intro: Vantanea aracaensis, commonly known as the Aracaense Vantanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, providing a striking visual contrast to its colorful blooms. Vantanea aracaensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
